Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of rosette complex set on volutes in added white outline with added red centre above two faded white bands; below, row of alternating red and faded white rays; exterior: at rim diagonal stroke pattern between pairs of lines; below, painted decoration consisting of part of neck (scale pattern with dotted circles) and shoulder of possible lion to right; pendant triangle and part of elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The interior decoration on the sherd stands as one of the most elaborate in the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 258, no. 479)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0540) (phase 2)
